text:
When customers undergo business
transitions such as divestitures,

mergers, and acquisitions,
CCOs and CROs are concerned

about potential drift from operational
standards and security baselines.

They also have to integrate
the risk and compliance

function of multiple business
entities.

I'd like to walk through
a couple of customer case studies
for such scenarios.

AWS customer Warner Brothers
Discovery, a global media and

entertainment company based
in New York City, wanted an automated

and centralized process to create
new AWS environments

and apply security policies
to manage mergers and acquisitions. Using

AWS Organizations created
a secure, centralized
deployment of AWS environments.

They reduced time to provision
new environments from 2 months
to 2 days.

They were able to reduce costs
related to large mergers

and acquisitions and achieved
faster time to market.

Another AWS customer Engie,
which specializes in low-carbon

energy and services, needed
to efficiently migrate thousands

of workloads to a separate
and secure environment

without impacting its production. The
company securely transferred

workloads from 70 AWS environments
to a new AWS environment

in 8 months and with zero downtime
using Organizations
and AWS Service Catalog.

Engie migrated 95% of workloads
in 2 months with virtually
no downtime or service interruptions.

The links to the detailed
case studies are in the description

below. Whether it is mergers,
acquisitions, divestitures,

or any other type of business
transitions, you can build

a centralized environment
using AWS cloud governance
tools.

These tools have the flexibility
to accommodate environments

with different operational
and security requirements. For

more information on this topic,
check out the links in the description.
